title: Optimize logo margins for better favicon visibility
description: Reduce margins in the devlog logo SVG files to improve visibility when used as favicon. The current logo uses only ~44x46 pixels of the 64x64 canvas, leaving excessive white space that makes the favicon appear very small.

notes.content: Optimized logo margins successfully. Reduced margins from 12px to 4px, scaled up all elements proportionally. Now uses 56x56 pixels instead of 44x46 pixels of the 64x64 canvas (~87% vs ~69%). Updated both core logo and favicon files with improved visibility for small size display.

context.businessContext: A clearly visible favicon improves brand recognition and user experience when the web app is bookmarked or displayed in browser tabs.
context.technicalContext: Need to scale up and reposition all SVG elements in both the core logo file and the web favicon to use minimal margins while maintaining the visual design proportions.
acceptanceCriteria: Logo elements use minimal margins (2-4px max)
Both core logo and favicon files are updated
Logo remains crisp and recognizable at small sizes
